intro: Trichosma simondii, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. Its small greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Trichosma simondii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
